Encryption Lab

Explore AES encryption modes used in DRM content protection

DRM Content Encryption
DRM systems typically use AES-128 in CTR or CBC mode. CTR mode enables random access for streaming, while CBC provides stronger diffusion. This lab demonstrates the core concepts with simplified operations.
Encryption Mode
Select AES operation mode

Counter Mode (CTR)

  • • Parallel encryption/decryption
  • • Random access to encrypted data
  • • Used in DASH/HLS streaming
  • • No padding required

DRM Encryption in Practice

Widevine

Uses AES-128 CTR for video encryption. Each segment has a unique IV derived from segment number, enabling efficient seeking in encrypted streams.

FairPlay

Apple's system uses AES-128 CBC for HLS content. Keys are rotated periodically and delivered via secure session with the device.

PlayReady

Microsoft's DRM supports both CTR and CBC modes. Often uses AES-128 CTR for DASH streams with per-sample encryption.
